intro: Coccoloba salicifolia, commonly known as the silky lacrosie, is a species of flowering plant in the family Polygonaceae. It is native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America, typically growing in moist, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped, silvery-green leaves that are covered in fine, soft hairs. It produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Coccoloba salicifolia is often used in ornamental horticulture for its attractive foliage and adaptability to various soil conditions.
